meanings.definition: The quality of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The illusiveness of the magician's tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The illusiveness of the mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent3: The illusiveness of the optical illusion made everyone laugh at their own confusion.
meanings.sent4: The illusiveness of the shadow play created a mysterious atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The illusiveness of the ghost story lingered in their minds long after bedtime.

meanings.definition: The state of being difficult to grasp or understand.
meanings.sent1: The illusiveness of the concept left the students scratching their heads.
meanings.sent2: The illusiveness of the puzzle frustrated even the most experienced solvers.
meanings.sent3: The illusiveness of the riddle made it the talk of the town for days.
meanings.sent4: The illusiveness of the theory seemed to slip through their fingers every time they tried to understand it.
meanings.sent5: The illusiveness of the hidden message slowly revealed itself after hours of contemplation.
